sentences.en: A lot of chemical reactions are reversible.
sentences.cn: 很多化学反应都是可逆的。

sentences.en: In small fields the changes are reversible.
sentences.cn: 在很弱的磁场中,这种改变是可逆的.

sentences.en: Intrauterine devices ( IUDs ) are safe and effective forms of long - term reversible contraception.
sentences.cn: 宫内节育器 ( IUDs ) 是安全有效且可逆的 长期 避孕方法.

sentences.en: Many operations, however, masquerade as Undo - proof , but they are really easily reversible.
sentences.cn: 然而很多操作伪装成 防 撤销的, 但其实很容易恢复.

sentences.en: Results: Most of the ADRs in adjuvant treatment were reversible.
sentences.cn: 结果: 辅助治疗的主要不良反应是可逆的.

sentences.en: Seat discs shall be reversible to extend check valve life.
sentences.cn: 阀座阀瓣应该是双向的,能够延长止回阀寿命.

sentences.en: Since optical paths are reversible, the opposite arrangement is also true.
sentences.cn: 因为光路是可逆的, 所以也可以反过来安装.

sentences.en: Specific lipase - catalyzed interesterification, especially acidolysis is reversible reaction, leading to equilibrium.
sentences.cn: 酶促酯交换反应, 尤其酸解是一种可逆反应, 即反应有平衡点,山于平衡的原因,通过这种反应得到的最终产品的得率不理想.

sentences.en: The cell is reversible and is readily recharged.
sentences.cn: 电池可逆,并容易重新充电.

sentences.en: The initial and final states are the same as for the reversible heating.
sentences.cn: 其始态及终态与可逆加热相同.

sentences.en: The problem is whether the chemical reaction is reversible.
sentences.cn: 问题就在于该化学反应是否可逆.

sentences.en: The process is not entirely reversible.
sentences.cn: 这种过程不能完全逆转.

sentences.en: These effects appeared to be reversible when air quality improved.
sentences.cn: 当空气质量改善时,这种效应是可以消除的.

sentences.en: These effects include reversible hearing loss and tinnitus ( ringing in the ears ).
sentences.cn: 这些副作用包括可逆性听力损伤和耳鸣.

sentences.en: We couple the reversible heat pump with the superengine.
sentences.cn: 我们将可逆热泵同“超机器”联接起来.

words.tran_cn: 颠倒的；相反的；（判决等）撤销的
逆转；[摄] 反转；[法] 撤销
背面；相反；倒退；失败；vt. 颠倒；倒转；adj. 反面的；颠倒的；反身的；vi. 倒退；逆叫
[数] 可逆性；可撤销；可反转性
逆转；回复；归还；[遗] 隔代遗传；[法] 继承权
颠倒（reverse的过去式和过去分词）；翻转
可逆的；可撤消的；可反转的

phrases.tran_cn: 可逆计数器；双向计数器

trans.tran_cn: 可逆的， 步骤、行动或疾病可恢复原状的， 可医治的，衣服、材料等可翻转的
trans.tran_en: a change that is reversible can be changed back to how it was before
